author: Ryan Tracy
title: U.S. Proposes Loosening Big-Bank Capital Rule
text:
WASHINGTON—Bank regulators proposed retooling a major capital rule, their second move in as many days that could benefit some of the country’s largest banks.
The Federal Reserve and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency on Wednesday proposed loosening the “supplementary leverage ratio,” a rule applying to eight large U.S. banks considered crucial to the functioning of the global financial system. The group includes JPMorgan Chase & Co., Wells Fargo & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
